result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J Leinonen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J Leinonen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 11:15am [mo]
Defendant Travis J Leinonen in court with Attorney John Robert Dade.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber confirms victim rights compliance.

ADA Teuber orally motions to amend Counts #1 and #2 to possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e)
--No objection from Atty. Dade
--The Court grants the State's motion to amend Counts #1 and #2 to possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e)

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Amended Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Convictions entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3.

Sentencing arguments by Counsel

On Amended Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $243 
--On Count #2 to pay costs of $243 
--Drug testing fee in the amount of $75
--Buy Money Reimbursement in the amount of $180

The Court does not order DNA surcharge due to date of violation

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 11:52am
Two letters submitted by Attorney Dade on behalf of the defendant
Request for substitution denied-The request is untimely per Wis Stat 971.20(4)
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Case called at 10:30 am [Clerk SH] 
Attorney John Robert Dade in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Dade informs the Court that he does not have authorization on file
Court reviews case file documents & indicates that Defendant received notice of today's hearing in person & via mail
DA Happ: Atty Dade did present office with a continuance of today's hearing; requests matter be recalled later today or in a week or two for plea/sentencing
Atty Dade: Did speak with Mr. Leinonen this morning; he was under the impression that there was no court today, which do believe is not his fault
Court informs parties that It will set matter for plea/sentencing
off-record: 10:32 - 10:34 am for scheduling
Court announces dates for the record; Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
Recess: 10:35 am 

NEXT: Schedule Plea/Sentencing June 8, 2015 at 11:15 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2015 at 02:40 pm.

[MK] case called at 3:08pm. 
Defendant Travis J Leinonen in court with Attorney John R Dade.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500  Signature Bond, with no special conditions.
The Court requires Attorney Dade to facilitate Mr. Leinonen being booked at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department, or ensuring that the booking information is transferred from a police agency to the Court. 
Mr. Leinonen waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds Mr. Leinonen over for Trial 

Arraignment: 
--service of the Information admitted; reading waived
--the Defense stands mute;  pleas of "not guilty" entered by the Court on the Defendant's behalf
ADA Shock verifies victim right compliance. 
recess 3:13pm. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/22/15 at 2:40pm  (2) Status Conference on 5/26/15 at 10:30am
